Rule: Being married instead of single increases the likelihood of earning more than $50k a year.
Having a professional or white-collar occupation rather than just a sales occupation is associated with higher income.
Higher education levels, such as a doctorate, are correlated with higher income.
Age does not seem to be a critical differentiator by itself since the same age (23) appears in both negative and positive outcomes.
Hours per week (36) remain constant across all scenarios and do not appear to be a differentiating factor.
